text: A thoughtful reflection on the legacy of Henry Kissinger - a man who, despite his flaws, was a master of realpolitik and a crucial architect of American foreign policy. In our current climate of ideological rigidity and strategic overreach, we would do well to remember his pragmatic approach to diplomacy. It's time for Washington to rediscover the art of statecraft and engage with great powers from a position of strength and realism, rather than falling prey to the hubris of exceptionalism."
